bug.summary: There is no short-circuit read for the task submitted to Yarn
bug.description:
Alluxio Version: v2.3.0 Describe the bug All tasks that are committed to Yarn are remote Alluxio Read,no short-circuit read. To Reproduce Our cluster deployment is as follows： <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42951757/101462311-0e600f80-3977-11eb-9f57-619edcf8c9e7.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42951757/101462442-2fc0fb80-3977-11eb-805c-e8657da4eaf9.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42951757/101462482-3c455400-3977-11eb-9bfe-7304f1eafae9.png></denchmark-link>
We run a Spark SQL task many times，there is no no short-circuit read. We added some log information in alluxio.client.block.AlluxioBlockStore.getInStream method. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42951757/101463128-fb9a0a80-3977-11eb-9818-998356d28320.png></denchmark-link>
When we read the file using the ‘bin/alluxio fs cat’, we can see that the log has the log output we want.However, after we submitted the Spark SQL task, we did not see the relevant logging information. Expected behavior Which piece of code should I debug
